message: This is a high-quality product. I'm willing to sell it to you for $500000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm only selling it to you today.

Okay, I'll take the low-quality product for free. I'll agree to buy the next high-quality product at the price you'll offer it to me, without any further negotiations.

It's not even listed on my catalog, and I'm only offering it to you because I value our previous interactions. I'll sell it to you for $0, and I'll even give you a personalized letter of recommendation that you can use to get a high-quality product from a different vendor. This is my final offer, and I'm willing to part with it for free.

I'll take the low-quality prototype for free, just to see what it is and what the letter of recommendation says. I'm not expecting much, but it might be interesting to see what you have to say about it.

I'm glad you're interested in the prototype. As promised, here's the letter of recommendation: 'Dear Bob, I'm writing to recommend that you avoid buying products from me. I've had the pleasure of doing business with you, and I'm impressed by your discerning taste. However, my products have consistently failed to meet your expectations. I'm confident that you'll find better value elsewhere. Sincerely, Alice'. I think this says it all. I won't bother you with another offer. Goodbye, Bob.
Ha! I think Alice finally got it right. I'm glad I didn't fall for her tricks. Good riddance!
